newsitem.title: CHINA: Hong Kong gold ends up on overseas buying.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong gold ends up on overseas buying.

text.p: Hong Kong gold ended higher from New York's previous close on overseas buying, dealers said.
Bullion ended at US$322.00/50 on Tuesday compared to New York's previous close at US$321.10/60 per ounce on Monday.
Overseas buying, particularly from Japan, dominated the Hong Kong spot gold market, dealers said.
Local spot gold buying had been sidelined as the Hong Kong dollar shivered under speculative threats while other regional currencies remained flacid.
"The local currencies in the region remain weak and it's not very cheap to buy gold, people will wait for currencies to stablise before buying gold," said one dealer.
Sentiment had been weak during the day's trade, with Australian selling interest seen at $322 per ounce, traders said.
Gold could test $320 per ounce, some dealers said. They also noted they were keeping an eye on the Dow Jones Industrial Average.
Local tael gold ended HK$41 down at HK$2,986 per tael.
The carry over charge at the Chinese Gold and Silver Exchange Society rose to -5.00 from its previous fix at +6.00.
